bibl.title: Sacred Signified: The Semiotics of Statues in the Greek Magical Papyri.
bibl.note: Paper first developed in a seminar on sacred images at The Ohio State University, and subsequently presented at a conference at the Università degli Studi di Siena. - There is little evidence for formal animation rituals in the descriptions of the creation of divine images in the Greek Magical Papyri: the statues should be approached as objects that point to the divine without necessarily enunciating a specific relationship between the physical statue and the god it represented.
